pullRequest.title: [JENKINS-60866] Un-inline non-standard showDetails
pullRequest.bodyText:
AbstractModelObject
Un-inline the JavaScript / CSS from the AbstractModelObject/error.jelly by re-using the showDetails.
To trigger this page, I had to put a breakpoint in Job.java#L1319, then configure a job, submit the form. The breakpoint is triggered, then, inside your favorite IDE, executing json = new net.sf.json.JSONObject(true) and let the rest of the code runs. This will throw a JSONException that will end display in that page.
I can bet there are other ways to trigger this error, but I prefered to keep focus on the un-inline as I had a way to trigger the page.
ZFSInstaller
Un-inline the JavaScript / CSS from ZFSInstaller/askRootPassword.jelly by re-using the showDetails.
To trigger this page, I put a breakpoint in ZFSInstaller.java#L237, then browse to http://localhost:8080/jenkins/administrativeMonitor/hudson.os.solaris.ZFSInstaller/start, confirm the POST, then the breakpoint is triggered, you can execute:
req.setAttribute("message", "testMessage");
rsp.forward(this,"askRootPassword",req);

and let the rest of the code run.
For both cases, the showDetails was using a custom inlined JavaScript while the showDetails feature was already present in hudson-behavior.js. The impact is that we are moving from a button to a link.
See JENKINS-60866.

Screenshots
AbstractModelObject

ZFSInstaller



Proposed changelog entries

(internal) Remove inline resources for non-standard showDetails


Proposed upgrade guidelines
N/A
Submitter checklist

 (If applicable) Jira issue is well described
 Changelog entries and upgrade guidelines are appropriate for the audience affected by the change (users or developer, depending on the change). Examples

Fill-in the Proposed changelog entries section only if there are breaking changes or other changes which may require extra steps from users during the upgrade


[n/a] Appropriate autotests or explanation to why this change has no tests
[n/a] For dependency updates: links to external changelogs and, if possible, full diffs


Desired reviewers
@mention

Maintainer checklist
Before the changes are marked as ready-for-merge:

 There are at least 2 approvals for the pull request and no outstanding requests for change
 Conversations in the pull request are over OR it is explicit that a reviewer does not block the change
 Changelog entries in the PR title and/or Proposed changelog entries are correct
 Proper changelog labels are set so that the changelog can be generated automatically
 If the change needs additional upgrade steps from users, upgrade-guide-needed label is set and there is a Proposed upgrade guidelines section in the PR title. (example)
 If it would make sense to backport the change to LTS, a Jira issue must exist, be a Bug or Improvement, and be labeled as lts-candidate to be considered (see query).

nodes.bodyText: To not confuse with the new "hidden-by-default" used in PluginManager
The style was not applied in the final HTML generated
